intro: Ouratea brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-stalked ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded forests. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
